text: Anyone know if its possible to turn off "Section" styles that are default from HubSpot in the wepage editor? I dont want my editors to be able to set their own background colors or paddings

Howdy, friends.

I have a form built (<https://share.hsforms.com/2CO-eM1bIQTigofluW_yQsQdchr8>) that will be embedded on a landing page. Ideally, the user will be pushed to a TYP after submission that uses their submitted email to create a unique referral link that they can share. However, when I'm testing it, the email field doesnt pass through immediately, leaving the generated URL missing the "referral_id" field.

If I refresh the page right after, the data loads properly, but i dont know how to make it load instantly for the user. Any advice? Will buy you a coffee if you can help me solve :smiling_face_with_tear:

Hey <@UTRKEGMKQ>, unfortunately the only real way to disable the section settings is to not use drag&drop areas/sections at all and write "hard coded templates"(with HS modules of course).

A "somewhat ok" workaround could be creating a bunch of custom row modules with predefined columns and options(you can get very creative with the choice option :wink: ). This would limit the options for the module, but if an editor would click on the section in the editor (or sidebar) he'd still get the section settings.

So again - the only current solution is to not use DND - which is not an option in most cases.

Hello!

How are you pulling the data from the query string? Are you using any JavaScript code for that?

Hi, <@U053KDY5TV1>! I'm just passing data from the form submission (specifically the email property) into a personalization token on the TYP that they are redirected to.

ie., if I submit the form as shown, the link generated would be <https://marketing.cloverleaf.me/request-demo-ref?referred_by=evan.schultz+referraltest@cloverleaf.me&utm_campaign=referral-program> on the thank you page. But what I'm running into is that the data isnt writing to the contact record fast enough to populate that "referred by" field fast enough, so it's being left blank.

admittedly, this seems like something that should have a simple solution and i'm just overlooking it :sweat:

set one up in workflow, send it over. you are going to have a problem with this because you can’t retrigger a workflow every time a note is created on an object. It takes a great amount of coding and property magic to make this work to retrigger each time
<https://share.zight.com/NQunYOox>

<https://share.zight.com/z8u9rpOQ>
search for HubSpot or hubl in the packages
